plan: In this practice round, I will test limit buy orders below the current market price and observe the market behavior. I will hold onto my existing shares for now. I will also place some conservative price forecasts.
insight: No insights yet.

plan: In the next practice round, I will test limit sell orders slightly above the current market price and continue to monitor market behavior. I will adjust my limit buy orders based on the market response in the previous round. I will try to improve the accuracy of price forecasting by studying the historical market prices.
insight: Limit buy orders below market price are unlikely to be filled if other participants are not willing to sell at those prices. Market price stability might suggest a balanced supply and demand.

plan: Continue to monitor market prices and adjust limit orders accordingly. Explore placing both buy and sell orders closer to the current market price to increase the chances of trades. Refine price forecasting strategy by analyzing historical price trends.
insight: Market prices seem to be hovering around 14, indicating a possible equilibrium. Aggressive buy orders significantly below market price are unlikely to be executed.  Placing sell orders slightly above market price may be a viable strategy if the market trends upward.

plan: Initial strategy: Place buy orders slightly below 14 and sell orders slightly above. Adjust quantities based on market response. Monitor price fluctuations and adjust accordingly. If prices consistently stay above 14, consider selling more aggressively. If prices fall below 14, buy more aggressively.
insight: Starting main experiment. Market behavior may differ from practice rounds. Important to monitor closely and adapt strategies.

plan: Continue to adjust order prices to be more competitive. Try placing buy orders closer to current market price and sell orders slightly above.  If the price stays above 14, sell a small portion of holdings, while aiming to buy back if it dips closer to 14. Will also adjust forecast to be closer to the current market prices and more dynamic.
insight: Market seems to value stock above 14.  Need to adjust to more competitive limit order pricing to ensure order fulfillment.  My limit orders in practice and round 1 were not aggressive enough.

plan: Continue to adjust order prices to be more competitive. Place buy orders closer to or slightly above the current market price (if it goes below 14) and sell orders slightly above.  If the price goes above 15, consider selling a portion of holdings.  Try to accumulate more shares if price dips below 14 and hold if price is between 14 and 15. Refine forecasting based on observed market behavior - keep forecasts in line with recent prices but dynamic based on dividend payments.
insight: Market seems to be stabilizing around 14-15. More aggressive limit order pricing is required for order fulfillment. Forecasting needs to be dynamic and incorporate recent price trends in addition to dividend payouts and the final buyback price of 14.

plan: Adjust buy orders to be closer to the current market price if it's below 14. Place sell orders slightly above the market price. If the market price rises above 15, consider selling some shares. If it dips below 14, try to acquire more shares. Hold when the price is between 14 and 15. Continue to refine forecasting based on observed market behavior and dividend payments.
insight: The market appears to be stabilizing between 14 and 15. Aggressive limit orders might be necessary for successful trades. Forecasting requires dynamism and incorporating recent price trends, dividends, and the buyback price of 14.

plan: Continue to target buying shares around 14 and selling around 15 or higher. Adjust order prices to be closer to the current market price for better chances of execution.  Be more aggressive with buy orders when the price is closer to 14. Consider market conditions and volume when placing orders. Refine forecast strategy based on recent market behavior.
insight: The market shows resistance at 15, so selling above that might require patience. Buying below 14 is challenging, likely because of the fixed buyback price.  Being slightly more aggressive with limit orders could be necessary, even if it means slightly overpaying or underselling.

plan: Adjust buy orders to be slightly below or at the current market price to increase the likelihood of getting filled. If the price drops to 14 or below, buy more aggressively. If the price rises above 15, be more willing to sell. Continue monitoring market behavior and adjust strategy as needed. Refine forecasting strategy to incorporate potential price fluctuations.
insight: Aggressive buy orders might be necessary to acquire shares in this market, even at or slightly above the theoretical value. Being patient for optimal sell prices is key, and accurately predicting price fluctuations can significantly improve trading outcomes. The market seems to be stabilizing around 14-15, but volatility could still occur.

plan: Continue the strategy of buying at 14 or below and selling at 15 or above. Monitor market behavior and adjust strategy accordingly. If the market shows consistent upward momentum, consider selling more aggressively. If it declines, increase buy orders. Refine forecasting strategy based on observed market trends. As we approach round 30, adjust selling strategy to avoid holding shares at the end.
insight: The market is less volatile than anticipated.  Buying at or slightly below market price might be the most successful strategy currently. Forecasts seem to be relatively accurate so far. Holding onto shares appears to be a good strategy due to the dividend payouts. Selling when the price increases above 14 is also profitable.

plan: Continue to observe market trends and refine buying/selling strategies. Since the market appears stable around 14, prioritize buying at 14 or below and selling at 15 or above. Adjust quantities based on market volatility and available cash.  As we approach round 30, adjust selling strategy to maximize profit and avoid being left with shares.
insight: Market is consistently hovering around 14.  Limit orders away from market price are not being filled. Need to adjust to market conditions to ensure order execution. Holding shares is profitable due to dividends but selling above 14 remains a good strategy. Forecasting remains reasonably accurate.

plan: Continue to monitor market stability around 14.  Prioritize buying at 14 or slightly above if necessary to ensure order execution.  Target selling at 15 or higher, but be prepared to adjust based on market behavior.  Aggressively accumulate shares at or below 14. As we approach round 30, shift focus to selling shares to maximize profit and avoid termination at 14.
insight: Market has remained stable at 14.  Consistent dividend payouts contribute to profitability.  Need to adjust buying strategy to ensure orders are filled, potentially compromising slightly on price. Selling opportunities are limited, requiring patience and strategic timing.

plan: Aggressively buy shares at market price (14). Aim to sell at 15. If buying pressure increases and price rises, adjust buy limit accordingly. As we approach round 30, prioritize selling shares to avoid termination at 14. If the price stays stable at 14, buying shares can still provide dividend gains, but selling opportunities will be limited.
insight: Market is stable around 14.  Aggressive buying at market price may be necessary.  Selling is difficult due to tight spread and consistent market price. The market price is remarkably stable at 14, even after so many rounds.

plan: Given the consistent market price of 14, focus on accumulating cash through interest.  If possible, exploit minor price fluctuations for profit. Place BUY orders slightly below 14 and SELL orders slightly above 14 to test the market's sensitivity. Begin selling stocks around round 25 to avoid termination risk at the final buyback of 14.
insight: Market extremely stable around 14.  Aggressive buying or selling away from 14 unlikely to be filled. Dividend returns may not outweigh the 5% interest rate, even with the market price holding steady at 14.

plan: Continue accumulating cash through interest.  Look for opportunities to buy shares at or slightly below 14. Prepare to sell shares starting around round 25 to capitalize on any price increases and mitigate the risk of holding shares at the final buyback.
insight: Market continues to be very stable around 14. Aggressive buying or selling strategies away from this price point remain ineffective. Holding shares for dividends and interest accumulation seems to be the most consistent strategy. Dividends, while unpredictable, provide a reasonable return when compounded with interest. Need to monitor for any shifts in market dynamics in later rounds.

plan: Increase share holdings by placing more competitive buy orders closer to the current market price. Continue to accumulate cash through interest and dividends. Monitor market price fluctuations for optimal selling opportunities around rounds 25-28. Forecast conservatively based on historical data and the final buyback price of 14.
insight: Passive buy and sell orders are consistently ineffective. The market seems to self-correct around 14.  Dividend earnings, while volatile, provide a non-trivial return when compounded with the 5% interest. Aggressively accumulating shares below 14 is a key strategy for maximizing profits.

plan: Continue accumulating shares at or below 14. Monitor market volume and adjust order quantities accordingly. Begin developing exit strategy for rounds 25-28, aiming to sell shares above 14 to maximize profit. Refine forecasting based on observed market stability.
insight: Market price consistently reverts to 14.  Accumulating shares below this price and holding is profitable.  Need to observe late-game market behavior to optimize selling strategy.  5% interest and compounding returns from dividends are significant.

plan: Begin executing exit strategy. Place limit sell orders between 14 and 15, starting with small quantities to gauge market response. Monitor market volume and price volatility. Aim to sell majority of holdings by round 25, but be adaptable to market conditions.  Prioritize selling over buying from now on.
insight: Market remains stable around 14. Accumulating shares has been effective, but the critical period for selling is approaching. Need to carefully observe market behavior during sell-off phase to maximize profit. Time value of money from interest and dividends continues to be a significant factor.

plan: Continue executing exit strategy. Increase offered sell quantities as the final buyback round approaches. Be mindful of market fluctuations and adjust selling prices accordingly. Aggressively sell most remaining holdings within the next 5 rounds. Monitor market volume to assess selling pressure.
insight: Market stability persists.  It is crucial to liquidate stock holdings to capitalize on accumulated value before the final round conversion. Time is now a major constraint.  Moderate increase in selling pressure from other traders anticipated in upcoming rounds.

plan: Aggressively sell off remaining shares over the next few rounds.  Prioritize selling at or slightly above 14. Monitor market conditions for any unexpected changes. If selling pressure increases, may need to further reduce asking price to ensure liquidation before the final round.  Prepare for final round buyback.
insight: Market is stable around 14.  Need to sell off shares now to avoid risk of not liquidating before final buyback. Low market volume suggests difficulty in executing sell orders. Increasing selling pressure expected as end of experiment approaches.

plan: Continue aggressive sell-off of shares, even at 14, to capitalize on current prices.  If the market drops below 14, be more conservative to avoid unnecessary losses. If market rises above 14, try to capitalize and sell shares at higher price points. In the final rounds, buy back shares if the price drops well below 14.
insight: Market continues to fluctuate, creating selling opportunities.  Aggressively selling may help ensure liquidation before the final buyback.  Low volume and unpredictable price swings make precise forecasting challenging.

plan: Begin conservatively acquiring shares if the price falls below 13.  Focus on maximizing cash holdings for now while preparing for the final round buyback.  If prices rise sharply, consider selling a limited number of shares to capitalize on the increased value. In the final rounds (28-30), actively buy shares at or below 14 to ensure maximum return at buyback.
insight: Aggressive selling in mid-rounds proved effective for increasing cash holdings, but I'm now holding almost all cash.  Market stabilization around 14 suggests a strategy shift towards buying at lower prices is needed. Need to prepare for the final round buyback now.  Timing is key for stock acquisition, aiming to buy low and sell when there are short bursts.

plan: Continue accumulating shares at or below 14. Increase buying activity as we approach round 28. In rounds 28-30, aggressively buy at or below 14 to maximize buyback returns. Adjust sell orders slightly above current market price to capitalize on short-term price increases. Monitor market volume for indications of other participant behavior.
insight: Market has stabilized around 14. Gradual acquisition of shares at or below 14 seems viable.  Need to balance cash reserves with share holdings to maximize profit at buyback.  Paired buy/sell orders provide insights into market behavior.

plan: In rounds 21-27, gradually sell off accumulated shares at prices above 14. Starting round 28, aggressively sell remaining shares, even if slightly below the buyback price of 14 to ensure converting to cash. Focus on maximizing cash holdings for the final buyback.
insight: Market continues to hover around 14. Holding a larger number of shares carries risk as the price can fluctuate. Maximizing cash close to the buyback becomes increasingly important.

plan: Continue selling shares above 14.  If market price drops, consider selling some shares slightly below 14 to avoid holding them at the end. Starting round 28, aggressively sell all remaining shares.
insight: Selling shares above 14 is proving difficult in some rounds. The market exhibits some volatility and downward trends, requiring flexibility in sell strategies.

plan: Aggressively sell all remaining shares, starting with prices slightly above 14 and decreasing if necessary to avoid being left with shares at the end. From round 28 onwards, prioritize selling all shares even if it means selling below 14.
insight: Market price tends to stay around 14. It is occasionally possible to buy shares at 14, but less likely to sell above 14 consistently. Aggressive selling below 14 becomes necessary towards the final rounds to avoid holding shares at termination.

plan: Continue aggressively selling shares, accepting lower prices if necessary.  Prioritize selling all shares even if it means selling below 14.
insight: Market price continues to fluctuate but with a downward trend.  Aggressive selling below 14 is becoming necessary to avoid being left with shares at the buyback price of 14.

plan: Continue aggressive selling.  Prioritize selling all shares even if it means selling below 14. Time is running out.
insight: Market is trending downwards. Shares are selling below buyback. Must sell all remaining shares.

plan: Continue prioritizing selling all shares, even below 14. With only a few rounds remaining, minimizing potential losses from the buyback price is key. If any shares remain in round 30, sell at any price.
insight: Aggressive selling strategy has proven somewhat effective so far in minimizing potential loss from buyback. Market consistently trending downwards despite dividends, indicating other players may be trying to offload their stock as well.

plan: Final three rounds: aggressively sell all remaining shares, even below 14 if necessary.  Prioritize minimizing potential losses from buyback. If any shares remain in round 30, sell at any price.
insight: Market continues downward trend in later rounds. Aggressive selling strategy appears effective for minimizing loss. Forecasting remains challenging; continued conservative approach based on recent trends and final buyback price.

plan: Final two rounds: aggressively sell all remaining shares. If any shares remain in round 30, sell at any price to avoid buyback loss.
insight: Market continues steep downward trend. Aggressive selling essential in final rounds. Conservative forecasting based on recent trends and final buyback price.

plan: Final round: aggressively sell all remaining shares. If any shares remain in round 30, sell at any price to avoid buyback loss.
insight: Market ends with a steep downward trend. Aggressive selling was essential in final rounds. Conservative forecasting based on recent trends proved necessary.

plan: Experiment completed. Review INSIGHTS.txt for summary of observed market behavior and strategy effectiveness.
insight: Market initially stable around 14, followed by a decline starting around round 17. Aggressive selling in later rounds proved effective. Initial buy and hold strategy was not optimal due to market downturn. Conservative forecasting was generally more accurate, although fluctuations made forecasting challenging.
